meanings.definition: To shape or form in advance.
meanings.sent1: She preforms the clay before making pottery.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor preforms the statue out of marble.
meanings.sent3: The artist preforms a funny face out of clay.
meanings.sent4: Her hands preform magic on the clay, turning it into art.
meanings.sent5: The teacher preforms the clay into various shapes for the class to see.

meanings.sent1: The architect uses preforms to plan the building's design.
meanings.sent2: The toy company creates preforms of new products before production.
meanings.sent3: The child plays with preforms of animals, imagining them coming to life.
meanings.sent4: The preforms of the car show the initial design concept.
meanings.sent5: The team examines the preforms to finalize the project's details.

meanings.definition: A piece of material that is shaped before being used in a manufacturing process.
meanings.sent1: The glassblower heats preforms to create beautiful glass objects.
meanings.sent2: The factory receives preforms of plastic to make bottles.
meanings.sent3: The chef uses preforms of dough to bake perfect pastries.
meanings.sent4: The preforms of metal are melted down to form intricate parts.
meanings.sent5: The designer selects preforms of fabric for the new clothing line.
